description: Chicken wings are great if you are cooking on a budget. Try them with this homemade coleslaw for a fuss-free dinner.
steps: In a large bowl, mix together all the chicken wing ingredients except for the wings themselves.
Remove the tips from the wings and halve at the knuckle. Add the wings to the bowl and toss really well until each wing is completely coated.
Put the wings on a large oven tray in a single layer. Drizzle with a little oil and pop in the oven. Bake for 20 minutes or until completely cooked through and golden-brown, turning half way through.

Meanwhile, make the slaw. Using the large holes of a box grater, grate the cabbage and carrots into a large mixing bowl. Add the remaining ingredients to the bowl along with a pinch of salt and pepper. Toss well.
Serve the wings with the slaw on the side and lots of napkins!
title: Sticky chicken wings with healthy slaw
